condition.description:
The urethra is the tube that allows urine to pass out of the body. In men, it's a long tube that runs through the penis. It also carries semen in men. In women, it's short and is just above the vagina. Urethral problems may happen due to aging, illness, or injury. They include

  • Urethral stricture - a narrowing of the opening of the urethra
  • Urethritis - inflammation of the urethra, sometimes caused by infection

Urethral problems may cause pain or difficulty passing urine. You may also have bleeding or discharge from the urethra.

Doctors diagnose urethral problems using different tests. These include urine tests, x-rays and an examination of the urethra with a scope called a cystoscope. Treatment depends on the cause of the problem. It may include medicines and, in severe cases, surgery.
condition.name: Urethritis

carousel_items: Take the medication exactly how your doctor tells you to.
Can cause diarrhea, nausea or vomiting.

basics.benefits_moa: Azithromycin is an antibiotic. It kills bacteria by preventing them from reproducing and repairing themselves.
basics.bottom_line: Azithromycin is good for treating many bacterial infections. It is also available as generic. Talk to your doctor if you've ever had liver disease, myasthenia gravis, or on medications to thin the blood, as the doctor may write an alternative.
downsides: Must space out antacids by at least 2 hours.
Has to be used with caution in people who've had liver disease.
Can't be used in people who've had myasthenia gravis.
Must be used with caution in people who are on medications to thin the blood (anticoagulants) because of increased risk of bleeding.
Can cause abdominal pain, diarrhea, vomiting, and nausea.

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take the medication exactly how your doctor tells you to.
Can cause diarrhea, nausea or vomiting.
Space out any antacids with magnesium or aluminum by at least 2 hours.
Can take with or without food.

risks_warnings.title: Diarrhea
risks_warnings.description: As with all antibiotics, Azithromycin can cause diarrhea. If this happens while you're taking the medication, taking probiotics in the form of yogurt, supplements or drinks a few hours after you take the medication may help. If you develop an unusual diarrhea with loose or bloody stools weeks after you finish the medication, talk to your doctor as this can be a rare but serious side effect.

description_processed.orig: As with all antibiotics, Azithromycin can cause diarrhea. If this happens while you're taking the medication, taking probiotics in the form of yogurt, supplements or drinks a few hours after you take the medication may help. If you develop an unusual diarrhea with loose or bloody stools weeks after you finish the medication, talk to your doctor as this can be a rare but serious side effect.

risks_warnings.title: Rash
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of severe skin rash that can require hospitalization or can cause death. These have been rare. Talk to your doctor immediately if you suddenly develop a severe blistering skin rash with fever.

carousel_items: You might feel better after a few doses, but you'll need to take all the medicine that was prescribed. Not taking all your medicine can cause the bacteria to get stronger and Tetracycline not to work when you need it again in the future.
It doesn't fight viral infections, so it won't work for the common cold.
Can make your skin more sensitive to the sun. Use sunblock or cover up.
Take your dose at least 1 hour before or 2 hours after meals, milk, or multivitamins with minerals.
Take your dose with a full glass of water and don't lay down right after taking it to prevent throat irritation.
Can cause nausea, vomiting, belly cramping, and diarrhea.

basics.benefits_moa: Tetracycline is an antibiotic. It prevents bacteria from growing, reproducing, and repairing themselves. It also changes your immune system response (immunomodulating effect), which helps treat skin conditions.
basics.bottom_line: Tetracycline treats many different types of infections and is cheap, but dosing and drug interactions may be somewhat of a hassle.
downsides: For most infections you'll need to take it 4 times a day (or every 6 hours).
It needs to be spaced out from food, milk, vitamins, and some medications.
Can cause tongue darkening, heartburn, nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea.
Tetracycline makes your skin more sensitive to the sun and ultraviolet light. Wear sunblock and protective clothing, and don't go tanning.
Interacts with birth control and makes it less effective. Use a backup form of birth control if you don't want to get pregnant.
Not a good choice for children ages 8 and under. Tetracycline can cause permanent staining of teeth in babies and young children.

downsides_processed.orig: For most infections you'll need to take it 4 times a day (or every 6 hours).
It needs to be spaced out from food, milk, vitamins, and some medications.
Can cause tongue darkening, heartburn, nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea.
Tetracycline makes your skin more sensitive to the sun and ultraviolet light. Wear sunblock and protective clothing, and don't go tanning.
Interacts with birth control and makes it less effective. Use a backup form of birth control if you don't want to get pregnant.
Not a good choice for children ages 8 and under. Tetracycline can cause permanent staining of teeth in babies and young children.

upsides: Effectively treats a wide range of conditions and is used for many different types of infections.
Effective for acne.
Cheap.
Good choice for people on kidney dialysis who need an antibiotic. Tetracycline isn't removed by dialysis, so the dose doesn't need to be changed.

Take it when you get up, so it waits an hour before breakfast.
I stopped taking it after finding an over the counter cream that was a 10% benzoyl peroxide solution that solved my acne problem the day of.

carousel_items_processed.orig: You might feel better after a few doses, but you'll need to take all the medicine that was prescribed. Not taking all your medicine can cause the bacteria to get stronger and Tetracycline not to work when you need it again in the future.
It doesn't fight viral infections, so it won't work for the common cold.
Can make your skin more sensitive to the sun. Use sunblock or cover up.
Take your dose at least 1 hour before or 2 hours after meals, milk, or multivitamins with minerals.
Take your dose with a full glass of water and don't lay down right after taking it to prevent throat irritation.
Can cause nausea, vomiting, belly cramping, and diarrhea.

risks_warnings.title: Changes in teeth
risks_warnings.description: Tetracycline and similar medicines can affect the growth and development of teeth in the fetus, infant and in children younger than 8 years old. Avoid using if you're pregnant, breast-feeding, or in children less than 8 years of age and ask your doctor about other effective medicine choices.

description_processed.orig: Tetracycline and similar medicines can affect the growth and development of teeth in the fetus, infant and in children younger than 8 years old. Avoid using if you're pregnant, breast-feeding, or in children less than 8 years of age and ask your doctor about other effective medicine choices.

risks_warnings.title: Reduced effectiveness of birth control pills
risks_warnings.description: If you're taking Tetracycline and also on birth control pills, the birth control might not work. You'll need to use a barrier form of birth control (condoms, diaphragms, etc.) while taking Tetracycline if you don't want to get pregnant.

description_processed.orig: If you're taking Tetracycline and also on birth control pills, the birth control might not work. You'll need to use a barrier form of birth control (condoms, diaphragms, etc.) while taking Tetracycline if you don't want to get pregnant.

risks_warnings.title: Decreased kidney function and kidney injury
risks_warnings.description: Tetracycline can lower your kidney function causing buildup of substances that should be removed from the body. There's a higher risk if you have current problems with your kidneys. It's also important that you don't take Tetracycline past the expiration date on your prescription label. This was more of a problem with older forms of the medicine, which could change and damage your kidneys.
risk_factors: Taking Tetracycline past the expiration date

description_processed.orig: Tetracycline can lower your kidney function causing buildup of substances that should be removed from the body. There's a higher risk if you have current problems with your kidneys. It's also important that you don't take Tetracycline past the expiration date on your prescription label. This was more of a problem with older forms of the medicine, which could change and damage your kidneys.

risks_warnings.title: Sunburn
risks_warnings.description: If you're taking Tetracycline and have to be outside in the sun for any amount of time, make sure you wear sunblock on exposed parts of your body or protective clothing. Your skin can be more sensitive to the sun and you're at a higher risk for sunburn.
risk_factors: Exposure to sunlight or ultraviolet light

description_processed.orig: If you're taking Tetracycline and have to be outside in the sun for any amount of time, make sure you wear sunblock on exposed parts of your body or protective clothing. Your skin can be more sensitive to the sun and you're at a higher risk for sunburn.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: You should avoid taking Tetracycline if you think you may get pregnant. Tetracycline can affect tooth and bone formation in the developing fetus and infant. The risk is greater the longer you take it, but can happen even with repeated short treatments. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor first about safer medicine choices to treat your condition.

description_processed.orig: You should avoid taking Tetracycline if you think you may get pregnant. Tetracycline can affect tooth and bone formation in the developing fetus and infant. The risk is greater the longer you take it, but can happen even with repeated short treatments. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor first about safer medicine choices to treat your condition.

risks_warnings.title: Increased pressure in the brain
risks_warnings.description: Tetracycline may cause increased pressure in the brain, called pseudotumor cerebri in infants and adults. There's more risk if you also take the drug Accutane. If you notice symptoms of nausea, vomiting, or pounding headache stop taking it and your symptoms should improve. Your doctor can check for changes in your eyes (optic disc swelling) before having you continue treatment.
risk_factors: Taking with Tetracycline with other medicines that can cause this effect (e.g. Accutane)

description_processed.orig: Tetracycline may cause increased pressure in the brain, called pseudotumor cerebri in infants and adults. There's more risk if you also take the drug Accutane. If you notice symptoms of nausea, vomiting, or pounding headache stop taking it and your symptoms should improve. Your doctor can check for changes in your eyes (optic disc swelling) before having you continue treatment.

risks_warnings.title: Liver injury
risks_warnings.description: Liver injury can happen rarely with Tetracycline. There's a higher risk if you have kidney disease. Your doctor should check your liver function before starting you on Tetracycline.

description_processed.orig: Liver injury can happen rarely with Tetracycline. There's a higher risk if you have kidney disease. Your doctor should check your liver function before starting you on Tetracycline.

risks_warnings.title: Development of more serious infections
risks_warnings.description: Using Tetracycline for a long period of time can cause a fungal infection or more serious bacterial infection including c-difficile diarrhea and severe colitis.  It can happen more than 2 months after stopping treatment. If you develop significant diarrhea while taking Tetracycline or after stopping it, let you doctor know right away.

description_processed.orig: Using Tetracycline for a long period of time can cause a fungal infection or more serious bacterial infection including c-difficile diarrhea and severe colitis.  It can happen more than 2 months after stopping treatment. If you develop significant diarrhea while taking Tetracycline or after stopping it, let you doctor know right away.

userStories.tip: It ruined multiple tendons in both my hands. I had to have the tendons surgically repaired. After that I developed tendon damage in both legs and my rotator cuff-but it totally cleared up my sinus infection!

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping

risks_warnings.title: Seizures
risks_warnings.description: If you've had seizures, taking Levofloxacin can make you more likely to have them. Talk to your doctor about alternatives.

risks_warnings.title: Changes in mood
risks_warnings.description: If you notice changes in your mood such as depression, nervousness, or mood swings after you start taking Levofloxacin, talk to your doctor.

description_processed.orig: If you notice changes in your mood such as depression, nervousness, or mood swings after you start taking Levofloxacin, talk to your doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Nerve damage
risks_warnings.description: Talk to your doctor immediately if you start to feel burning, tingling, numbness, pain or you can't tolerate heat or cold. This could be a sign of nerve damage. It can happen as soon as you start taking the medication and may not go away if you stop it.

description_processed.orig: Talk to your doctor immediately if you start to feel burning, tingling, numbness, pain or you can't tolerate heat or cold. This could be a sign of nerve damage. It can happen as soon as you start taking the medication and may not go away if you stop it.

risks_warnings.title: Changes in blood sugar
risks_warnings.description: People with diabetes may notice changes in their blood sugar while taking Levofloxacin. Talk to your doctor if you should check your blood sugar more often, and follow what they tell you if it gets too high or too low.

description_processed.orig: People with diabetes may notice changes in their blood sugar while taking Levofloxacin. Talk to your doctor if you should check your blood sugar more often, and follow what they tell you if it gets too high or too low.

risks_warnings.title: Sunburn

risks_warnings.title: Diarrhea from a superinfection (an infection that happens after, or in addition to, an earlier infection)
risks_warnings.description: Taking antibiotics, like Doxycycline can increase your chance of getting certain fungal or bacterial infections that causes diarrhea and can be contagious. If you develop an unusual diarrhea with loose or bloody stools weeks after you finish the medication, talk to your doctor since this can be a rare but serious side effect.

risks_warnings.title: Rash

carousel_items: Take it with or without food.
It's dosed based on your weight, so different people will have different doses.
If you're using the suspension, refrigerate it and use it within 10 days.

It's common to feel better before you're supposed to stop taking Erythromycin, but make sure to take it for the entire time your doctor prescribed it. Skipping doses or stopping early can lower the drug's effectiveness and increase the chance that the drug won't work as well next time.

basics.benefits_moa: Erythromycin is a macrolide antibiotic that prevents and treats a variety of infections. It works by preventing bacteria from growing and multiplying.
basics.bottom_line: Erythromycin works well to treat a variety of bacterial infections, but check for drug interactions before taking it.
downsides: Interacts with a lot of drugs, so don't take it with colchicine, statin drugs, verapamil, amlodipine, or diltiazem.
Diarrhea and other stomach problems are common side effects.
Can cause liver problems, so people with previous liver problems need to be closely monitored while on Erythromycin.

downsides_processed.orig: Interacts with a lot of drugs, so don't take it with colchicine, statin drugs, verapamil, amlodipine, or diltiazem.
Diarrhea and other stomach problems are common side effects.
Can cause liver problems, so people with previous liver problems need to be closely monitored while on Erythromycin.

upsides: It's used to treat a variety of infections caused by bacteria.
It comes as an oral suspension and as a tablet.
You can get a test done that'll show you if Erythromycin will work for you.

upsides_processed.orig: It's used to treat a variety of infections caused by bacteria.
It comes as an oral suspension and as a tablet.
You can get a test done that'll show you if Erythromycin will work for you.

userStories.tip: I'm taking it for tooth infection and so far the side affects are worse than the tooth ache. allergic to penicillin so hence why was given this one.  getting bad stomach cramps and feel nauseas.
difficult to give a tip - i have been taking it for years on a "as needed" basis w/ no problems.

drugs.name: Erythromycin

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take it with or without food.
It's dosed based on your weight, so different people will have different doses.
If you're using the suspension, refrigerate it and use it within 10 days.

It's common to feel better before you're supposed to stop taking Erythromycin, but make sure to take it for the entire time your doctor prescribed it. Skipping doses or stopping early can lower the drug's effectiveness and increase the chance that the drug won't work as well next time.

risks_warnings.title: Liver damage
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of liver damage that can require hospitalization or can cause death. These have been rare. Talk to your doctor if you notice pain in your abdomen, loss of appetite, yellowing of your skin or eyes, or dark colored urine.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of liver damage that can require hospitalization or can cause death. These have been rare. Talk to your doctor if you notice pain in your abdomen, loss of appetite, yellowing of your skin or eyes, or dark colored urine.

risks_warnings.title: Heart rate problems
risks_warnings.description: Erythromycin can cause a dangerous arrhythmias called QT interval prolongation and torsades de pointes. Erythromycin should be avoided in people who have had arrhythmias in the past. Elderly people are more likely to have this side effect.

description_processed.orig: Erythromycin can cause a dangerous arrhythmias called QT interval prolongation and torsades de pointes. Erythromycin should be avoided in people who have had arrhythmias in the past. Elderly people are more likely to have this side effect.

risks_warnings.title: Diarrhea from a superinfection
risks_warnings.description: Taking antibiotics, like Erythromycin can increase your chance of getting certain fungal or bacterial infections that causes diarrhea and can be contagious. This is a superinfection, an infection that happens after, or in addition to, an earlier infection. If you develop an unusual diarrhea with loose or bloody stools weeks after you finish the medication, talk to your doctor since this can be a rare but serious side effect.

points.name: Abdominal pain
points.hlt: gastrointestinal and abdominal pains (excl oral and throat)
